title: Color Palette Examples
text: vignette demonstrates use color palettes ggplot2 scales provided cute package.

title: Color Palette Examples
text: can extract colors palette using style_palette function:

title: Color Palette Examples
code: set.seed(123) df <- data.frame(   x = rnorm(100),   y = rnorm(100),   category = sample(letters[1:5], 100, replace = TRUE) )  ggplot(df, aes(x, y, color = category)) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_style(option = "vibrant_mix") +   ggtitle("Scatter Plot with Vibrant Mix Palette")

title: Color Palette Examples
code: df_summary <- data.frame(   group = c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E"),   value = c(20, 35, 15, 40, 30) )  ggplot(df_summary, aes(x = group, y = value, fill = group)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   scale_fill_style(option = "warm_spectrum") +   ggtitle("Bar Plot with Warm Spectrum Palette")

title: Color Palette Examples
code: df_heatmap <- expand.grid(x = 1:20, y = 1:20) df_heatmap$z <- with(df_heatmap, sin(x/2) * cos(y/4))  ggplot(df_heatmap, aes(x, y, fill = z)) +   geom_tile() +   scale_fill_style_c(option = "cool_calm") +   ggtitle("Heatmap with Cool Calm Palette")

title: Color Palette Examples
code: df_line <- data.frame(   x = 1:100,   y1 = cumsum(rnorm(100)),   y2 = cumsum(rnorm(100)),   y3 = cumsum(rnorm(100)) )  ggplot(df_line, aes(x = x)) +   geom_line(aes(y = y1, color = "Line 1"), size = 1) +   geom_line(aes(y = y2, color = "Line 2"), size = 1) +   geom_line(aes(y = y3, color = "Line 3"), size = 1) +   scale_color_style(option = "pastel", direction = -1) +   ggtitle("Line Plot with Reversed Pastel Palette") #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated.

title: Color Palette Examples
code: df_grouped <- data.frame(   group = rep(c("Group 1", "Group 2", "Group 3"), each = 4),   subgroup = rep(c("A", "B", "C", "D"), 3),   value = runif(12, 10, 50) )  ggplot(df_grouped, aes(x = group, y = value, fill = subgroup)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +   scale_fill_style(option = "vibrant_mix") +   facet_wrap(~subgroup, scales = "free_x") +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) +   ggtitle("Grouped Bar Plot with Vibrant Mix Palette")

what: Custom ggplot2 Theme for Elegant Data Visualization
title: Custom ggplot2 Theme for Elegant Data Visualization
text: cute package provides custom ggplot2 theme creating elegant consistent data visualizations. features clean white background light gray grid lines, customized text elements, refined styling various plot components. theme aims enhance readability aesthetic appeal ggplot2 graphics.

title: Custom ggplot2 Theme for Elegant Data Visualization
text: Clean white background Light gray grid lines Customized text elements titles, subtitles, axis labels Refined styling various plot components

title: Custom ggplot2 Theme for Elegant Data Visualization
text: can install development version cute GitHub :

title: Custom ggplot2 Theme for Elegant Data Visualization
text: installation, can use cute theme ggplot2 visualizations:
code: library(ggplot2) library(cute)  # Create a plot with the custom theme ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = rownames(mtcars)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   theme_bar()

title: Custom ggplot2 Theme for Elegant Data Visualization

title: Available Color Palettes — style_colors
text: Use style_palette extract palettes desired length

title: Available Color Palettes — style_colors
text: object class list length 5.

title: Style ggplot2 color scales — style_ggplot2_scales
text: ggplot2 fill color scales derived style guide - `scale_color_style()` `scale_fill_style()` provide discrete fill functions - `scale_color_style_c()` `scale_fill_style_c()` provide continuous fill functions

title: Style ggplot2 color scales — style_ggplot2_scales
code: scale_color_style(option = "blue_gradient", direction = 1, ...)  scale_fill_style(option = "blue_gradient", direction = 1, ...)  scale_color_style_c(option = "blue_gradient", direction = 1, ...)  scale_fill_style_c(option = "blue_gradient", direction = 1, ...)

title: Style ggplot2 color scales — style_ggplot2_scales
text: option name color palette use. See style_palette available options direction greater equal 0, return standard direction; otherwise reverse direction palette ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2 scale functions

title: Style ggplot2 color scales — style_ggplot2_scales
code: library(ggplot2) tmp <- data.frame(x = rnorm(100), y = rnorm(100), z = rep(c("a", "b", "c", "d", "e"), 20))  # using a discrete scale ggplot(tmp, aes(x, y, color = z)) + geom_point() + scale_color_style()   # changing the palette used when creating a discrete scale ggplot(tmp, aes(x, y, color = z)) + geom_point() + scale_color_style(option = "warm_spectrum")

title: Style Color Palette Constructor — style_palette
text: Extract color palette desired length

title: Style Color Palette Constructor — style_palette
text: option name color palette use. Options 'blue_gradient', 'warm_spectrum', 'cool_calm', 'vibrant_mix', 'pastel' n number colors return. Currently, scales limited 5 colors

title: Custom bar chart theme — theme_bar
text: function returns custom ggplot2 theme bar charts.

title: Custom bar chart theme — theme_bar
text: ggplot2 theme object
